item.description:
Do you have an interest in sustainability? Are you curious about new energy-saving building systems and technology? Does looking at gorgeous photography of architecture inspire you? For these reasons and more, come to Build Boston, the largest regional design and construction industry tradeshow in the country.
....nightly cocktail parties on the show floor
....350+ exhibits
.... only $15
November 18-20, 2008
http://www.buildbosto...

And for those of you concerned about preparing for the tough economic times ahead, we are holding three free sessions at Build Boston on the matter.

On November 18, 19 and 20 at Build Boston, the BSA hosts three free, informal gatherings of architects and other architecture-firm professionals interested in exploring responses to the imminent challenges of our faltering economy. All three sessions run from 10:30 am to noon at the Seaport World Trade Center.

At each of these three events, one or more attorneys, accountants, fee-collection advisors, insurance advisors and, job-placement professionals will be available to respond to questions and to offer informal advice on the broad range of legal, financial, employment and other business-management and career issues firms and individuals are facing now or may soon encounter...and to highlight BSA, public-agency and other services individuals and firms may find useful.

The conversation on Tuesday, November 18 is specifically for sole practitioners (it is Build Boston event # SA19)…Wednesday, November 19 is designed for principals of small and mid-size design firms (event # SB19)…and Thursday, November 20 is intended for individual design professionals working in design firms and in every other traditional and non-traditional setting including designers employed in corporate, institutional, public-agency and other roles (event # SC19).

There is no charge for these events but registration is required online at www.buildboston.com or by calling 800-544-1898.
item.name: Build Boston
